code_generation.page_description: Learn how to use AI effectively for code generation, review, debugging, and testing. Master techniques for generating better code with clear prompts.
code_generation.title: Code Generation with AI
code_generation.subtitle: Master the art of generating, reviewing, and testing code with AI assistance
code_generation.learn_generation: Generate high-quality code with clear, structured prompts
code_generation.learn_review: Use AI for comprehensive code reviews and security audits
code_generation.learn_debugging: Debug complex issues faster with AI assistance
code_generation.learn_testing: Generate unit tests, E2E tests, and documentation automatically
code_generation.vague_problem: ‚ùå Problem: Too vague, too many ambiguities. Claude might generate incomplete or incorrect code.
code_generation.clear_benefit: ‚úì Benefit: Specific requirements and constraints lead to better code with fewer revisions.
code_generation.debug_pro_tip: üí° Pro Tip: Include error messages, expected behavior, and what you've already tried for faster, more accurate debugging.
code_generation.refactoring_1: Extract Method - Break large functions into smaller, reusable pieces
code_generation.refactoring_2: Consolidate Conditionals - Simplify complex if/else chains
code_generation.refactoring_3: Replace Magic Numbers - Use named constants for clarity
code_generation.refactoring_4: Simplify Complex Expressions - Break down compound conditions
code_generation.refactoring_5: Rename Variables - Use clear, descriptive names
code_generation.refactoring_6: Remove Dead Code - Eliminate unused variables and functions
code_generation.translation_example_desc: Convert a Python data processing script to idiomatic JavaScript with equivalent functionality.
code_generation.do_1: Always review AI-generated code carefully before using it in production
code_generation.do_2: Test generated code thoroughly with edge cases and error scenarios
code_generation.do_3: Ask for explanations of complex logic to understand the code
code_generation.do_4: Request code with type safety, error handling, and validation built-in
code_generation.do_5: Use AI to generate unit tests alongside the code
code_generation.do_6: Request security reviews for code handling sensitive data
code_generation.do_7: Ask for performance considerations and optimization suggestions
code_generation.do_8: Version control all code and maintain audit trails of AI-generated changes
code_generation.avoid_1: Don't blindly copy-paste AI code without understanding it
code_generation.avoid_2: Don't skip testing just because AI generated the code
code_generation.avoid_3: Don't ignore security warnings or deprecation notices
code_generation.avoid_4: Don't generate code without specifying error handling requirements
code_generation.avoid_5: Don't assume AI code follows your project's conventions and style
code_generation.avoid_6: Don't use AI code in production without peer review
code_generation.avoid_7: Don't forget to credit AI assistance in code comments or documentation

techStack.hero_subtitle: Built on cutting-edge tools and methodologies to ensure prompt quality, code excellence, and systematic development
techStack.claude_code_intro: Seamlessly integrated AI coding assistant that understands your project context and generates code following established patterns.
techStack.claude_code_point_1: Generates features following Next.js 15 + Supabase patterns
techStack.claude_code_point_2: Refactors code while maintaining TypeScript safety and consistency
techStack.claude_code_point_3: Debugs issues with full project context understanding
techStack.claude_code_point_4: Creates documentation aligned with project standards
techStack.claude_code_tab_overview_content: Claude Code is an AI-powered development assistant seamlessly integrated with your project. It reads your CLAUDE.md guidelines and generates code that follows your established patterns and conventions. Access it at claude.ai/code or via the CLI.
techStack.claude_code_tab_setup_content: Access Claude Code at https://claude.ai/code or install the Claude Code CLI. Link your repository to enable context-aware assistance. The assistant will automatically reference your CLAUDE.md file for project guidelines and conventions.
techStack.claude_code_tab_usage_content: Describe your requirements in natural language. Claude Code understands your project architecture and generates implementation following your patterns. Ask for code review, refactoring, debugging, or documentation. The assistant maintains TypeScript safety and design consistency throughout.
techStack.claude_code_tab_examples_content: Feature generation: 'Create a new dashboard component with Next.js 15 App Router' ‚Üí Generates component following project patterns. Refactoring: 'Improve error handling in the auth module' ‚Üí Updates code with proper error management. Documentation: 'Generate API docs for the webhook handler' ‚Üí Creates comprehensive documentation.
techStack.claude_code_tab_best_practices_content: Provide clear requirements with examples. Ask for code review to validate implementations. Use for feature development, refactoring, debugging, and documentation. Always review generated code before merging. Reference CLAUDE.md patterns for consistency.
techStack.ragas_intro: Industry-standard framework for evaluating and measuring the quality, effectiveness, and relevance of AI prompts.
techStack.ragas_point_3: Provides quality metrics and detailed reports
techStack.ragas_tab_overview_content: Ragas is an open-source framework for evaluating LLM outputs using industry-standard metrics. It helps measure prompt quality across multiple dimensions including faithfulness, relevance, and contextual accuracy. Install with: pnpm add ragas
techStack.ragas_tab_setup_content: Install Ragas: pnpm add ragas or npm install ragas. Configure with your preferred LLM provider (OpenAI, Claude, etc.). Set up evaluation datasets. Initialize metrics for your use case. Integrate into your CI/CD pipeline for continuous quality monitoring.
techStack.ragas_tab_usage_content: Evaluate single prompts: ragas evaluate --prompt "your-prompt" --responses "response-data". Batch evaluate: ragas evaluate-batch --input prompts.json --output metrics.json. Generate reports: ragas report --metrics faithfulness,relevancy,context-precision. Use in code: const metrics = await evaluatePrompt({prompt, responses, model})
techStack.ragas_tab_examples_content: Evaluate before publishing: Check faithfulness > 0.8 and relevancy > 0.85 before adding to featured collection. Benchmark improvements: Compare metrics before/after prompt optimization. Monitor quality: Track trending metrics across all prompts. Identify issues: Find prompts with low precision or recall.
techStack.ragas_tab_metrics_content: Faithfulness: How closely responses follow prompt intent (0-1). Answer Relevancy: Relevance of generated responses to prompt (0-1). Context Precision: Quality and relevance of retrieved context (0-1). Context Recall: Completeness of context retrieval (0-1). Semantic Similarity: Alignment between expectations and responses (0-1).
techStack.spec_driven_intro: Clear specifications before implementation ensuring alignment between requirements, design, code, and validation.
techStack.spec_driven_point_4: Ensures quality assurance at every step
techStack.spec_driven_tab_overview_content: Spec Driven Development prioritizes clear specifications before implementation. This methodology ensures alignment between requirements, design, code, and testing. Everyone understands feature intent before coding starts, reducing ambiguity and rework significantly.
techStack.spec_driven_tab_workflow_content: 1. Write Spec: Create detailed feature specification in GitHub issue with requirements, architecture, and success criteria. 2. Review: Team reviews for clarity and feasibility. 3. Implement: Developers code following approved specification. 4. Validate: Testing ensures requirements are met. 5. Document: Update CLAUDE.md with new patterns.
techStack.spec_driven_tab_github_content: Use Issues with 'spec' label for feature specifications. Create Discussions for design decisions. Link PRs to specification issues for traceability. Use checklists in issues to track spec completion. Include spec templates for consistency. Tag stakeholders for review.
techStack.spec_driven_tab_template_content:
# [Feature Name] Specification

## Description
Brief overview

## Requirements
- [ ] Requirement 1
- [ ] Requirement 2

## Architecture
How it fits existing system

## Database Changes
Tables/columns affected

## API Endpoints
Endpoints to create/modify

## Testing Strategy
Validation approach

## Success Criteria
Definition of done
techStack.spec_driven_tab_best_practices_content: Write specs in clear, accessible language avoiding jargon. Include examples and use cases. Define scope boundaries clearly. Get spec approval before implementing. Update spec if requirements change. Use checklists to track progress. Review completed work against spec.

techStack.faq_subtitle: Everything you need to know about our tech stack
techStack.faq_integration_q: How does Claude Code integrate with our codebase?
techStack.faq_integration_a: Claude Code reads your CLAUDE.md file and understands your project structure, conventions, and patterns. It generates code that follows your established guidelines. Link your GitHub repository during setup for seamless integration.
techStack.faq_cost_q: What is the cost of implementing Ragas?
techStack.faq_cost_a: Ragas is open-source and free. You only pay for LLM API calls used for evaluation. Implementation is straightforward with a few lines of code or CLI commands.
techStack.faq_onboarding_q: How long does it take to onboard with Spec Driven Development?
techStack.faq_onboarding_a: Teams can start writing specs immediately. Most teams see productivity improvements within the first sprint. Full organizational adoption typically takes 1-2 months with training.
techStack.faq_scalability_q: Is this tech stack scalable for high growth?
techStack.faq_scalability_a: Yes. Vercel's edge network scales globally. Supabase handles millions of concurrent users. Our Next.js + TypeScript architecture supports growth without major rewrites.
techStack.faq_security_a: Supabase offers row-level security (RLS) for data protection. All data is encrypted in transit and at rest. GDPR, SOC 2, and other compliance standards are supported.
techStack.faq_customization_q: Can we customize these tools for our specific needs?
techStack.faq_customization_a: Claude Code adapts to your patterns in CLAUDE.md. Ragas metrics are configurable. All other tools are open-source and fully customizable.
techStack.faq_migration_q: What's the migration path from other tools?
techStack.faq_migration_a: We provide migration guides for each tool. Claude Code can help automate code refactoring. Ragas integrates with existing pipelines. Contact support for detailed planning.
techStack.faq_support_a: Community support via Discord and GitHub. Enterprise support with SLA available. Documentation covers all tools. Regular training sessions and workshops.
